item.title: Handler trouble
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

Under ‘public class ClickingOBJ {’, Add this:

client c = (client) server.playerHandler.players[ID];

And replace:

sendMessage("hithar");

With:

c.sendMessage("hithar");

Read full topic

item.title: Handler trouble
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

Well i’ve made a ClickingOBJ handler.
Here is what’s inside;

[code]
//100% By Jordie - Object case handler.
import java.io.*;

public class ClickingOBJ {
public void objectClick(int objectID, int objectX, int objectY, int face, int face2, int GateID, client c) {
switch (objectID) {
case 2213:
sendMessage(“hithar”);
break;
}
}
public void objectClick2(int objectID, int objectX, int objectY) {
switch (objectID) {
}
}

} //END OF FILE.[/code]
I get this error;

ClickingOBJ.java:7: cannot find symbol symbol : method sendMessage(java.lang.String) location: class ClickingOBJ sendMessage("hithar"); ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

I don’t know how i’d get the class to recognise the method without adding tons more like frames, etc.
Also I think i’ve added it correctly in server class. Here is what i added;

public static ClickingOBJ ClickingOBJ = null;

And;

ClickingOBJ = new ClickingOBJ();

In the main method. Any ideas as I fail at handlers.

Read full topic
